# Speeding up RSA

p, q are almost same, so we can use Fermat Factorization.

```python
# !pip install pycryptodome
# !pip install gmpy2
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
import gmpy2

n = 


p = gmpy2.isqrt(n)

while True:
    q, r = gmpy2.t_divmod(n, p)
    if r == 0:
        break
    p += 1

c = 
e = 65537

phi = (p-1)*(q-1)
d = pow(e, -1, phi)
m = pow(c, d, n)

print(long_to_bytes(m))
```

> b'grodno{Ofru*YgePg8h}'

flag is: **grodno{Ofru*YgePg8h}**
